definition: to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Make? C designs that allow easy, cost-effective disassembly and re-use of parts at end of life.
sentences.chinese: 低成本，容易拆解，在生命週期結束零件可重新利用。

sentences.english: In the process, they made several interesting observations about the new hardware.
sentences.chinese: 拆解過程中，他們對新硬件進行了若干有趣的觀察。

sentences.english: Domestic handset from dissembling lock, Software repair.
sentences.chinese: 國產手機免拆解鎖，軟件修復。

sentences.english: In other words, it untangles data from business logic.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，從商業邏輯上拆解了數據。

sentences.english: The plant is the only nuclear weapons assembly and disassembly facility in the US.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是美國唯一一個組裝和拆解武器的兵工廠。

sentences.english: In China, media have also reported citizens being poisoned handling so-called e-waste, old computers that are imported and torn apart for their scrap metal.
sentences.chinese: 電子垃圾是指被回收並被拆解爲廢金屬的舊電腦。

sentences.english: Teardowns provide a look inside a device and should not be used as disassembly instructions.
sentences.chinese: 拆解設備提供內部觀摩，不應被視爲反組裝指引用。

sentences.english: Free replacement delivery and scrapping of the wrongly supplied parts at the customer's premises.
sentences.chinese: 免費上門更換並在顧客處拆解錯發部件。

sentences.english: iFixit: "Siri, may we disassemble you for all to see?"
sentences.chinese: 我們能把你拆解給大家看嗎？

definition: to recycle/to reclaim/to retrieve/to recover/to recall (a defective product)
to change one's costume/to repackage/to remodel/to refit/to modify/to convert
to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
